abstract: Ben S. Bernanke, the Federal Reserve chairman, had one of his shortest and least contentious appearances on Capitol Hill since the recession started five years ago.
snippet: Ben S. Bernanke, the Federal Reserve chairman, had one of his shortest and least contentious appearances on Capitol Hill since the recession started five years ago.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One clear sign that the economy is improving: a Senate hearing featuring the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, ended ahead of schedule Thursday after the committee members ran out of questions.

headline.main: Bernanke Has a Day of Sedate Testimony
headline.print_headline: Bernanke Has a Day Of Sedate Testimony
